description: From hood +‎ -ie (diminutive suffix). In sense “person wearing a hoodie”, influenced by sense -ie (“person associated with suffixed noun, often derogatory”); compare townie.

entries.meaning: A sweatshirt with an integral hood and, sometimes, a large kangaroo pocket at the front.
examples: Synonyms: kangaroo, kangaroo jacket, bunny hug
You can buy hoodies on the cheap in summer.

entries.meaning: (Britain, slang, often derogatory) A young person wearing such a sweatshirt, usually a male, stereotypically associated with antisocial behaviour.
